data.text:
March 21st, 2024

I am so sorry to learn that Jarvis died. We worked together for many years and I was thinking of him because itâ€™s tax season. Jarvis made doing taxes less stressful. He was considerate, funny, really detail oriented and fast. I send my deepest sympathy to Robin, his sons and the family.

~Petra M Blix

~Client and friend, Chicago, IL

December 5th, 2023

Since 1976 Jarve was always my good friend and confidant. I will always remember him.

~Stephen and Mia Bronson

~Friend and collegue., Scottsdale

December 5th, 2023

Our world is a sadder place without Jarvis in it. It would be a much better place if more people followed the examples and principles that Jarvis set and lived by while he was with us. A true friend for life, certainly mine, he lived each day as a man of honor and integrity willing to help those less fortunate than him when afforded the opportunity. He was my mentor in business and in life. I will try to continue to follow the path he set me on, but he will always be a tough act to follow. I miss him so much but know he will not be forgotten by all those in his life that he touched as only he could.

~HENRY E LUKEE

~Close friend and business partner, ORLANDO, FL

December 5th, 2023

When I first met Jarve, I knew that he was someone special!

Jarve was my boss, teacher, friend, financial advisor, mentor, confidant and phone a friend if I was ever on Cash Cab or Who wants to be a Millionaire.

I will hold our last conversation deep in my heart and so fortunate we were able to express the admiration and love we had for each other.

Sending Robin, Paul, Allie, Adam, Michael and the rest of the Friduss family, my deepest condolences.

Rest in peace Jarve XOXO

Debbie

~Deborah Clarke

~Boss and Friend, Huntley IL

December 5th, 2023

Iâ€™m so grateful my life came into contact with Jarve.

He was my boss at FLS, my life coach how to live a good life, my health coach towards self control with chocolate, and the best St. Patrickâ€™s day leprechaun Iâ€™ve ever encountered.

We would meet at 3:00 for a 5 minute chocolate break during tax season. A tradition I carry on today.

In those moments I am transported back to his corner office and our brief, but deeply cherished, chats and laughter for those few minutes.

When the light hits the paperweights that he shared with me, and a rainbow appears, I canâ€™t help but hear him tell about the technique used to create the weight and how his eyes sparkled when he spoke.

And the excitement when a new weight was unveiled in the office!! Anyone who was in the office would pause to see the new treasure.

Sending my prayers today and Iâ€™ll keep a candle lit.

~Kathie Schneider

~Friend and colleague, Prospect Heights Illinois

December 5th, 2023

He was so charming,

He also was smart,

I loved him so much,

With all of my heart.

Always so thoughtful

And always so kind,

Compassionate, with

A razor sharp mind.

Happy and loving

And truly the best

Of men, by accounting,

To which l attest.

His beautiful life

Played out like a song

Of symphonic notes,

Both mellow and long.

May he sleep soundly,

In well deserved peace,

While my memories

Of him, never shalll cease.

Diane Kulwin Dresser

Cousin, Westlake Village, California

~Diane Kulwin Dresser

~Cousin, Westlake Village, California

December 2nd, 2023

My deepest condolenceâ€™s to the family. Jarvis was kind, loving and there 40 plus years to guide us in our business. You will be missed.

~George and Elaine Sianis

~Friend/ Business, Naples. Florida

December 1st, 2023

Jarv was a dear , kind, caring friend.It was a joy to be with Jarvis and Robin. Always a wonderful time. We will miss his smile and positive attitude in every situation. He was always thoughtful and we could talk at length on almost any subject. Jarvis was one of the best . Al and I will miss Jarvis in this world. All our love and condolences to his whole family. May he rest in peace and his memory be for a blessing

Love,
